content.description: 5.8 crux off the ground to solid hand jamming.  Angle left on 5.6 face to belay shared with Cruise Corner.  Double rope rap from large block.
content.protection: Nuts and single set of cams to 3 inches.
content.location: Hideout Wall, right side.  Thirty feet right of Cruise Corner.

content.description: Obvious wide crack on left side of wall.  Crux off the ground, then fairly strenuous off-width to comfortable stance below roof.  Double rope rap from tatty anchor.

Not to be confused with Helter Shelter which is to the right of this climb. Scramble over a little formation onto a right facing corner. Make a move or two to get you into the corner 5.8. After this mostly easy and fun moves to get to a shelf. Once on the shelf climb a crack on the face, pull a move or two of 5.9 till the angle backs off and build an anchor. There are plenty of options for an anchor on this shelf. 50 meters We belayed the second over about 80ft, on the climbers right, to some chicken heads above the anchor to Popeye’s crack and rapped to the anchor then down to the ground.
content.protection: Wires .2-2 I used a 5 but just because I had it you should be able to climb this just fine with hand pieces
content.location: On the far left side of the wall, a pillar that forms a clean right facing corner

content.description: Excellent lie back in large right facing corner.  Move right after 60 feet into ackward chimney.  Continue right on easy face to belay in alcove shared with We Be Jammin.  Double rope rap from large block.
content.protection: Single set of cams to 3 inches.

content.description: a nice little boulder problem above pitch#1 of Popeyes. After the roof, it backs off to low angle to the anchor. Its a nice little punch if you have anything in the tank after (the newly bolted slab) A Cold Day In Hell 11+ which also leads to the anchor of Popeyes!From the anchor of Popeyes crack clip the bolt that protects the roof above. Find a few obvious holds and now find out how to use them to pull the roof, don't forget out right. I found that screaming really helped! if you pull the roof use the crack and plates to protect low angle to the anchor
content.protection: light rack .75-2 and a double length for a tie off
content.location: starts off the top of Popeyes crack

content.description:
Hideout Wall offers several quality crack climbs of moderate difficulty.  Secluded with a northeasterly aspect, it's a great place to enjoy solitude and afternoon shade.   

  See photo and route descriptions in the Kerry guide.
